Reviews.Title: “Fire Hazard !!!”
Reviews.Author: andrewflanagan
Reviews.Content: Well where do I begin... In the current climate I'm not going to formally report these cowboys as most small businesses are feeling the pinch but I sure as hell am gonna come out with it on this forum. THIS HOTEL IS A FIRE HAZARD. Nuff said, make up your own mind. There was no running water in my room. The mattresses were extremely uncomfortable. I hear from Tripadvisor that bed bugs and credit card also fraud are par for the course. I had to laugh upon checking out when I explained to the cynical manager at the counter that my room had no running water. His response was "well you should have told me, it was probably an airlock or something". He was right, my fault I guess :) YOUVE ALL BEEN WARNED!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: rocmanil
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for several years now when I go to the UK on business. I have just returned from London staying at this hotel for 30 days. As always i found the staff at this hotel to be extremely friendly and eager to make certain my stay is positive. My room was clean and comfortable. The toilet and shower just outside my room was cleaned throughly everyday and was spotless. The comments of bedbugs in the rooms are groundless. If there were bedbugs in one room they would have spread quickly to the entire hotel! I have found the location of this hotel to be superb for getting around London as it is served by the Picadilly and District underground lines and the entrance is just a few meters from the hotel. My only warning would be that it is located along Warwick Road which is quite busy and if your room is on that side of the building the noise might bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Basic place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: wille_w
Reviews.Content: The hotel very close to the underground station (Earls Court) and easy to find to. Although the reception room was pretty small I was allowed to leave my luggage there for the day to collect later before going to the airport as there was no separate luggage room. The staff were friendly and free wi-fi is good service. Warwick Road is pretty heavily trafficked and noise easily heard all night long so you better have your ears plugged. The (single) rooms are pretty small but it's ok if you stay just to have a bed for the night. Breakfast area is kind of cosy but coffee served is instant. Depending on which shower room you use the standards may vary but for the most part neat, clean and tidy. Not too bad a place to stay for budget travelling. The transaction device was a bit old-fashioned and I had to sign instead of securing my pay by pin on my second stay (the first time was ok). Also on my second stay the TV in the room didn't work, not much of a downside but to have a glimpse of the news before hitting the pillow would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY AND FULL OF BEDBUGS!!”
Reviews.Author: LauraZgZ
Reviews.Content: This place is infested with bedbugs. They bit me all over and after one month I still show some marks in my body. The manager is a miserly man that doesn't care about this infestation problem always he gets the money. Public health inspectors should investigate this hostel. Also, when I informed the manager about the bites and the bedbug problem he fake ignorance and assured me it was the first time this has happened in his hostel. Moreover, he replaced the mattress and the pillow but left the old mattress in the landing and in 5 days he never took it to the trash so, I can perfectly guess that it is still there and being used by other clients. DON'T CHOOSE THIS PLACE OR YOU WILL REGRET IT!! SERIOUSLY!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and No Bedbugs in my room”
Reviews.Author: rocmanil
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel at least 8 times over the last and I have always had a pleasant stay. I find all the staff friendly and my room always clean. Perfect it is not but at the rate I pay for a room I am thoughly satisfied. I have never seen a bedbug in my room contrary to what the other reviews are saying. I will continue to stay at this hotel as I fine it just fine. Perhaps people are expecting to much. If you want five star service etc. then get a room in a five star hotel and be prepared to pay the high price.

Reviews.Title: “A BED BUG NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: julialcantara
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! The hotel is very dirty, every room is covered with bed bugs!! Someone should shut this place down!!

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: masa2802
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with my Master Card. It was only after I booked it that I read the reviews on tripadvisor. There was one case of credit card fraud reported there. In two days there was an illicit transaction on my card. I would like to warn everyone intending to book this hotel not to use their credit card. Needless to stay that I cancelled the hotel and chose another one.

Reviews.Title: “I should have read more reviews before going to this "hotel"”
Reviews.Author: dermeister
Reviews.Content: The first review I write but maybe it helps others picking something more valuable. Though the receptionist was friendly, the indian "boss" was unfriendly when I asked for an official invoice as I was there for a business trip. "We usually dont so this" was his answer, and "the room wasn't booked on the company name" even though it was. When paying by creditcard, he automatically charged me in my home currency, which was a worse exchange rate (I checked later) and he wanted me to sign this receipt saying I understood that I was given the chance between paying in GBP or my home currency and that this was irreversible, even though he didnt tell me anything, just gave me the receipt to sign, which I did not and told him to cancel this transaction and make a new one in GBP, which he did but in not a very friendly way. We didnt like the room, there were hairs on the bedlinen and the floor was filthy. The room was towards the street so it was quite loud. We didnt even enter the brakfast room in the cellar once, because the hotel was so dirty we knew what we could expect from the breakfast and went outside rather to pay more and get decent quality. Although we wanted to stay close to Earls court, so the hotel had a great location for us, we definitely never go there again and advise everyone rather to pick someting else. The year before we had stayed in the easyhotel close by which was cleaner and had a better price/value.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: faery_7
Reviews.Content: Credit card fraud took place at the Hotel Earls Court. I'm from South Africa, and booked a room 8 weeks ago over the internet for 1 night, but opted to pay cash on my arrival. The credit card was just given as security incase I don't pitch up. Yesterday money was taken from my credit card for a European Flight on Olympic Airline (which is a European airline, bearing in mind I'm back in my home country South Africa for the Worldcup!). I don't use my credit card often, so I could easily backtrack, as I've only used the card details at the hotel, as I've taken cash with and never used my card (infact, I left it at home in South Africa) I've called the airline, but they could not give me any info as the person did not book directly with them, but over the internet with my card details. I've called the manager of the Hotel, and he told me to send an email with my complaint. I did not hear from him a day later, so I called again today, and he said he can't do anything about it FULLSTOP Stay away from these criminals - I was not even put at ease, or tried to being helped. I know I did not use my card for anything else, and my bank statement also showed very little movement, and seeing it's a European airline, it is quite obvious to me. Hope you are all safe from criminals like this ! much love, Sufaery

Reviews.Title: “Earls court hotel is a bin!”
Reviews.Author: willimandala
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the earls court hotel at 1300hrs on the 18th of feb to meet our fellow friends in tears in the hallway at the state of the room they had stayed in the night before. While the receptionast was very polite and showed us our room as well as our friends room from the night before its was only then we realised how bad the situation was in relation to the hotel we were staying in. As i walked into the room beside the receptionist desk i was met at the door my a huge rat which shuffled passed my feet and ran out on to the street. My girlfriend and i were horrifed at the stench of the room and not only this but the massive gaps in the walls as you will see from the pictures i will post caused by the infestation of rats in the hotel.There were droppings all over the carpet their were in fact maybe 3 or 4 more rats in the room where at this stage my girlfriend nearly got sick with fear. My friends were in the hallway still seething from knowing they had slept in a room which was not suitable no matter what the price for human beings! I spoke with the receptionist and he made a phone call to the other hotel which was full up and could not take us in for the night as their was no possible way we were going to stay in the hotel with the infestation of rats! I in turn asked him to cancel our reservation as at this stage my friends in the hall way were physically sick and my partner near to tears. I did not asked for my booking fee back i just asked for a place to stay which the hotel could not provide and it was at his stage that things turned nasty as the hotel manager came down and told me that if i canceled staying i would have to pay for the room for the night, even though they could not find us another room in another of their hotels, i was still 'expected' to stay in this room that was infested with rats! While i knew it was good value for money no human being in this day and age should have to pay to stay with rats. Remember it was at 1 o clock in the day when i arrived and at this stage i was just of the plane and tired i just wanted to settle down but being told their was no other room and i would have to pay for the room i was not going to stay in apart from givin near 12 hours notice.At this stage it was not even the money it was the principle! How were we expected to stay in a room full of rats and rats droppings and then to be told we would have to pay even though it was one o clock in the day was beyond reasoning! They would of had all day to hire out that room to some other poor unfortunate soul. I will be returning to london very soon as i had a wonderful time but i will not let this matter lie down. I agree you pay for what you get but you dont have to pay to stay with rats you can gladly lie outside bins any where for free and they will hang around. What i want is for people to know how bad this place was and from other stories in the area this was not the first time this has happened in this hotel! Since noone has asked even to see if i got somewhere safe to stay for the night i will present a full report to the health and safety board of accommodations and show them the pictures of the appalling state of earls court hotel. Not only did i NOT get a refund or another place to stay but what i experienced from the manager of the premises was pure foul mouthed abuse!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: alyfenSheffieldUK
Reviews.Content: I've never done a bad review but here goes. Firstly this is not a hotel, its a B & B. I stayed here because there was not another room to be had ,when I had to stay in London at short notice. London was booked up!. I'm afraid it had nothing going for it. The odd smell is there when you go in: the room was basic, which was to be expected but the shower was dirty with huge muddy foot mark and black hairs and the (only) towel threadbare. The bed was lumpy and the carpet ..well.. The place was noisy - traffic going past all night and I didn't sleep a wink. I had no choice but to stay, as it was so late at night but I could not wait to leave. Really try everywhere else before here (I did!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price for a VERY basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmacleantaylor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Earl's Court on a solo trip to London on the way home to Toronto from East Africa. Earl's Court had better rates for single rooms than many hostels in central London. Reading the reviews made me nervous about the stay, but overall I was satisfied. My single room (no ensuite) cost approximately $50 (Canadian) per night (175 pounds for 5 nights). The hotel is in West Kensington one minute's walk from the Earl's Court subway station, which is KEY. This station is on the border between Zone 1 and Zone 2 of the transit system, so its as far out as you can go while still only paying the Zone 1 price. This helps save on your weekly travelcard cost. It is on a main road and with your windows open in the summer months (no a/c) it can be noisy. The mattress was uncomfortable. The room has a sink and mirror but is very small. The sheets and towel were clean and the room itself, while certainly worn, was clean. The bathroom was down the hall and tolerable, but not "nice", separate toilet room was fine. They include breakfast, which consists of toast, cereal and tea/coffee. Friendly staff. FREE wireless internet! (quite fast connection) Overall, great value/location for a budget traveller who isn't too picky.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: travelnickbn3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here despite reading the other reviews and found the hotel to be ideal for my stay. I was only there for one night, and it was the night of the Brits at the nearby Earls Court Exhibition Centre. Apart from the noise of the taxi's outside I had no issues at all. The room was clean, warm and comfortable. There were no problems with the staff, apart from arriving to an empty reception. Tea and Coffee was available outside of the room, and as I had taken the budget option there was no ensuite bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: weegill
Reviews.Content: We were only staying for one night as we were had tickets for Wimbledon. I couldn't have stayed for any more! It looks ok from the outside but inside it wasn't! The gentleman on reception wasn't exactly friendly and didn't seem too happy to be working. Our room was on the ground floor opposite reception. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the shelves were all dusty, the tv aerial was held up by a coathanger. There was a makeshift dresser which was all damaged and the cupboard door didn't have a handle. Someone had even taken the batteries from the remote control for the tv. The ensuite was a tiny wet room - see my pic! The walls are paper thin, we could hear the person next door laughing until about 2am then he started snoring so we hardly slept. Continental breakfast was included but we decided not to have that!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, Seamy, Revolting, Sleazy, Horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Sapnas
Reviews.Content: They say a picture paints 1000 words. I really wish I'd taken my digital camera to show you just how disgusting this place is. The only good thing about this hotel is it is right near Earls Court tube station so you can escape when you realise just how bad this establishment really is. If you are wise, please accept my judgement. Know that I am not exaggerating, and JUST DO NOT STAY THERE. Here is my story...... When I arrived the Greek guy on reception (who was wearing t-shirt and shorts) was too busy watching TV to notice I was there. I knocked on the window. He said "hang on a minute, mate!" and made me wait whilst he watched the concluding part of whatever he was watching. I thought to myself: "I don't want to hang on. I've been travelling for 11 hours!" After a very long check-in process I was given the key to my room on the first floor. I noticed that this "non-smoking" room smelled of stale sweat and cigarettes, as, in fact, did the entire hotel. The dÃ©cor must have dated to the early 70s. The flaking yellow wallpaper was impregnated with smoke. Despite there being an ashtray (a strange thing for a non-smoking room), the surface of the cheap formica table was pitted and scorched with crater-like cigarette burns. The dirty army green bedspread that covered the musty and unwashed blanket was also littered with cigarette burns. The nasty, ill-matched and sickly pea-green nylon curtains (I have thrown better away) were not made of enough fabric to draw across the window. The ledges, windows and pelmets were thick with dust. The carpet was matted with years of congealed dirt. Its original colour is anyone's guess....oh and the taps had brown rings of sludge around them. No kettle in the room. Instead you have to use a communal one downstairs. Not wanting to use the powdered milk that was there I ventured into the kitchen in the basement and opened the fridge......AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARGH a bowl of what was once tinned tomatoes covered in green mould sat on the mildew-covered shelves! No way was I going to eat here for breakfast! It is almost impossible to find words that can convey the seaminess of this place. To be hugely outdated is one thing, but to be seamy, dirty and sleazy is quite another. Went back up to the room for a shave. No towels, and no plug in the sink. Went down to reception and asked for a towel. The guy said "oh sorry mate, I forgot," and gave me a towel (which, to be fair, was perfectly clean, thank goodness). As for the plug, he said: "well it should be there." I explained that there wasn't, and he grudgingly went and found me one, so that was ok. The communal bathroom and toilet (which stank of urine to the point it made my stomach churn) was so dirty I had to buy some bleach and cleaning materials from the local shop and bleach everything before I used it. At least hot water was in plentiful supply. The extractor fan sounded like a pneumatic drill. The light switch was ill-placed and dangerous. I couldn't get to sleep there, and felt ill-prepared for the interview day that followed. I have stayed in hotels cheaper, yet far better than this. Everything about this place was sad, old, worn, decayed, unpleasant and seamy. It is quite clearly run by people who do not care. I half expected a dead body to fall out of the cheap MFI flat-pack wardrobe (from about 1975) that wobbled when I opened it. Just some old musty blankets and a cigarette pack in there. YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in ever!”
Reviews.Author: Hopperina
Reviews.Content: Extremely disgusted with the hotel directly opposite the reception. The flip doors opens to 2 different room, extremely stupid design there. The room was very DUSTY, very dark even with lights on. The bed was not even big for a single, how can it be a double bed?? The toilet was extremely small. The carpet looks unvacuumed for the last 6 months. Very noisy as it was just next to the road. You can even hear people talking outside! Hotel's breakfast was normal, self-made bread and toast. The receptionist looks Italian and guess this hotel is a private and home managed. I hope they get to see the rating here. I really regret paying 60 pounds for such a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Simple points abou the hotel”
Reviews.Author: epic_swell
Reviews.Content: Ok, the points to note about this hotel: Poor points: Room was not what I requested (twin instead of double ensuite) Communal shower was dirty Breakfast was a very basic continental breakfast No hot water in room or elsewhere (couldnt shave) decor was pretty shabby too many stairs to climb to room Good points: Central and close to tube station

Reviews.Title: “Just mediocre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Convienent location to tube station but I really didn't like this hotel. Some good things, some bad. Good for one person who's not staying a long time. Rooms are too small, hot water almost never ran in the shower or at the sink in the rooms. Room telephone was filthy. A bit over-priced for what you get. Don't bring a lot of luggage as there is no lift. Friendly staff. Probably would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Could Go Either Way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feelings about this hotel from the beginning. My room was on the top floor and the elevator didn't go all the way up. Not a huge problem at first - until I discovered that the small elevator couldn't carry both me and my 1 suitcase at the same time. Both me and my suitcase together could not have weighed more than 150 lbs. However, the woman at the desk pushed the buttons in the elevator and sent up my luggage to meet me. The room was small, as I have found most European hotel rooms to be. That was no surprise or disappointment. The room was clean and comfortable. I was supposed to only stay one night and fly home the next day, but there was an emergency and I couldn't get home right away. The staff made sure that I had a room for as long as necessary and suggested places to eat and helped me figure out ways to make my meager budget work for the extra week I was there. I was worried about being able to pay for the room, but they made me feel welcome and told me not to worry and that it would all be worked out in the end. The staff there were great and went out of their way to help me out. But... when it was time for me to finally leave, I resorted to sliding my suitcase down a flight of stairs because I couldn't lift it and there was no elevator. I'm afraid I woke up the entire hotel at 5 am, but it was all I could do! I would stay there again, but I would ask for a room near the elevator! It was so close to the tube and it wasn't a long walk to Harrod's!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Indranils
Reviews.Content: Although our twin room was booked more than one month ahead, we got probably the worst room in the building. We were given room B5, which was on the basement and just below the Meeting room on the ground floor. All the time we heard footsteps and all. The room was extremely small. Other than one pair of bunk bed, there was nothing and no place to sit or to spread open your luggage. Toilets are outside and clean. But showers are horrible. Showers are fixed to the wall and water falls almost on the wall instead on you. So you have to be close enough with the wall itself. Showers are not suitable for tall people. Since we had problem with room B5, we asked for another room and we were shifted to room B10. Same "facilities" as before without the noise. Room was few square inches bigger with two chairs. If you have lots of luggage, you will have to struggle to get downstairs through the staircase. The lights in the room were very low (I mean Very). Now the good things. The Basement kitchen was very well equiped and clean with all the standard facilities (microwave, electric oven, refrigerator, cupboards, racks, plates, cups etc.) The breakfast was very good. (cornflakes, milk, bread roll, pie, apple, jam, butter, coffee, tea, hot chocholate, orange juice etc) Staffs at the reception were friendly and helpfull. My major complain is about the room and the beds. We paid 52GBP for the room per night and it was surely not worth. About security, We found our room kept unlocked after the cleaning lady had finished her work inside our room. Next time if I am there, I will look for something better. The place is unbeatable. its only three minutes walk from Earls Court Tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest place to stay, especially if you need a wake up call.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Earls Court Hotel during the last week of March. When we arrived, the desk clerk was very hostile. We had originally booked for 6 nights, but were told that as long as we gave 48 hrs. notice, we could cancel a few nights if our plans changed. The desk clerk yelled at us and told us that we would have to pay 20% commission for each night that we cancelled, even though we were going to stay 4 nights. The "breakfast" consisted of toast. That's it. We ended up eating it only the first morning. We had 2 tours scheduled and asked for a wake up call for those mornings. The first morning, the wake up call was 25 minutes late. THe second morning, it never came, so luckily we happened to wake up in time to get to our bus. The morning that we had to leave for the airport, the call never came. Talk about stressful. The rooms were very small. Our garbage was taken out every 3 days. The bathroom in our room was quite shabby with holes in the walls and peeling wallpaper, flooring, etc. The extra blankets in the closet had "hairs" on them. We paid almost 60 pounds a night for the place, which wasn't worth it. I wouldn't stay there again. The one nice thing about the place was that it was about 50 steps from the tube station, and in a rather quiet area. Besides that, I would stay away.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Earls Court
HotelInfo.Address: 28 Warwick Road, London SW5 9UD, England
